image.altText: An ASX share market digital board listing stocks in green and red lighting alongside the ASX logo

props.synopsis: The ASX has surged out of the blocks, climbing more than 6 per cent in early trade after US stocks rocketed higher on Donald Trump's tariff pause. The S&P 500 posted its biggest gain since 2008. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX leaps following Wall Street's gains on Trump tariff u-turn

image.altText: A man in a suit sitting at a desk with a folder open before him

props.synopsis: Perched on one shoulder, the demons have been appealing to Donald Trump's long-held love of tariffs. On the other side, the angels have been appealing to his long-held love of deal-making.

title.children: The White House is spinning this as 'the art of the deal', but Trump isn't

image.altText: Two men in suits shake hands in front of flags of Australia and China.

props.synopsis: China's ambassador suggested Australia should stand in "solidarity" with China against tariffs, but Deputy PM Richard Marles said Australia would stand up for its own interests.

title.children: Marles says Australia will not 'join hands' with China against Trump

image.altText: trump dinner

props.synopsis: The US president was confronted by a force far greater than his own and the office he now holds overnight. The bond market, an arena where brutality knows no bounds and where the participants take no prisoners.

title.children: Donald Trump met his match. It's called the bond market

image.altText: Prime Minister in a white cap standing at a podium

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese is in Far North Queensland pledging $10 million for the Great Barrier Reef. Follow live.

title.children: PM misquotes actor Tom Cruise as he defends Labor's climate record

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Dutton says he's 'not mucking around' as he's quizzed about commitment to reduce prices this year
Dutton says he will make the 'right and tough' decisions on Trump
Australia will 'stand on its own two feet' rather than joining hands with China, PM says

image.altText: A young mother sitting on a couch with a smiling toddler lying across her lap

props.synopsis: New research shows educational disadvantage begins when children are as young as two if they can't access childcare. With about one quarter of the country living in "childcare deserts", experts are demanding more from both parties.

title.children: 'That trajectory is set': Research finds educational disadvantage begins at two

image.altText: An aerial photograph shows a sprawling mix of pink and beige buildings and palm trees on a beachfront property.

props.synopsis: As countries and markets grapple with the ongoing fallout from his tariff policy, some are wondering if Donald Trump has a bigger plan to overhaul global trade and reset America's industrial economy.

title.children: What is Trump up to? The so-called 'Mar-A-Lago Accord' could be a clue

image.altText: Anthony Albanese holds his arms out while speaking at a Sky News leaders' debate

props.synopsis: The third week on the campaign trail will be critical, before the Easter break and the commencement of early voting, and polls suggest the contest remains tight.

title.children: US admits 'running up the score' with Australia, leaving little room for deals

image.altText: Workers

props.synopsis: Six people contracted the infectious disease after spending time in Sydney's CBD over the past three weeks, according to NSW Health.

title.children: Health warning for people who have been in Sydney CBD over past 10 days

image.altText: A worker checks cable connection on a solar panel at a solar farm

props.synopsis: While experts weigh in on the great energy debate, one builder says the industry has already made up its mind.

title.children: In the debate between renewables and nuclear, some say it's 'game over'

image.altText: A woman wearing a red t shirt and black glasses stands across the road from Westfield Bondi Junction

props.synopsis: Survivors say they are still breaking down and deeply traumatised by the stabbing attack on April 13, 2024 at Westfield Bondi Junction that killed six people.

title.children: 'I still have nightmares': The high price paid by Bondi stabbing witnesses

image.altText: Cracked and damaged road with asphalt that falls away to become a gravel shoulder, with a 100 kilometre an hour sign amid trees

props.synopsis: The Coalition has promised to improve access to health care and child care in the regions, boost connectivity and improve roads with a $20 billion future fund.

title.children: Coalition pledges $20b regional fund for 'forgotten Australians'

image.altText: a large wavy sculpture outside the brisbane court precinct in the sunshine

props.synopsis: The Brisbane Childrens Court heard the teenager allegedly researched bomb making instructions and purchased explosives ingredients.

title.children: Teen accused of terror plot allegedly tested homemade explosives

image.altText: A student receives a measles vaccine injection at the Ecole Polytechnique Federale de Lausanne (EPFL).

props.synopsis: Australia is in the middle of a surge in measles cases amid a global spike and declining childhood vaccination rates. So what precautions should be taken to avoid widespread transmission?

title.children: Doctors warn of travel risks as measles cases surge in Australia

image.altText: Lady standing in front of media

props.synopsis: Housing Minister Clare O'Neil is seeking to keep approving development projects ahead of the election regardless of the government being in caretaker mode, but the Coalition has heavily criticised the request.

title.children: Labor wants to break election rules to approve housing applications

image.altText: GettyImages-2209395005

props.synopsis: The kids of some of golf's biggest names put on a show as their dads try to avoid winning 'jinxed' Par 3 competition.

title.children: Crowd goes wild as champ's kid holes long putt, as golfers avoid winning 'jinxed' competition

image.altText: Sonia Ballal stands out the front of her house.

props.synopsis: Victoria's building regulator has warned consumers it is investigating a builder over allegations it has built potentially unsafe homes in Melbourne's outer suburbs.

title.children: Watchdog sounds alarm on Melbourne builder's 'defective work'

image.altText: Wide aerial shot of Alice Springs street with bush and mountains in background

props.synopsis: A Danish tourist has left Alice Springs after she was punched and stomped on in an unprovoked attack, just hours after she arrived in town. A man has been charged over the incident.

title.children: Danish tourist knocked out in unprovoked attack leaves Alice Springs

image.altText: Fallow deer roaming in bush land.

props.synopsis: A project to rehabilitate wetlands in Tasmania has been going since the 80s. It keeps getting destroyed by deer — and the community group involved has had enough.

title.children: Decades of work lost to feral deer — and this group are sick of it

image.altText: Two middle aged men in jackets speak at a press conference.

props.synopsis: An investigation into the sexual assault of a nurse at Townsville's public hospital found some clinical staff view unsafe patient behaviours as "just part of the job".

title.children: Queensland hospital 'fell short' in response to nurse sexual assault

image.altText: A man wearing a black denim jacket standing in front of a body of water

props.synopsis: An election candidate's acknowledgement of his criminal past has prompted questions over whether a section of Australia's Constitution should be updated.

title.children: Would you trust a person convicted for fraud to represent you in parliament?

image.altText: Workers dismantle a tent

props.synopsis: Homeless woman Carol Ross says council workers gave her one hour to remove her personal belongings from her tent before they loaded it onto the back of a garbage truck.

title.children: Rough sleepers' tents binned as council outlaws homeless camping

image.altText: Harry McKay holds his hands on his head

props.synopsis: As Carlton's star goal kicker Harry McKay prepares to return to AFL after three weeks off, the 27-year-old has opened up about his struggles.

title.children: 'It was really scary': Carlton star opens up on mental health struggles

image.altText: Outback flooding in South Australia's far north.

props.synopsis: While communities around Adelaide cope with drought, another part of South Australia is dealing with a "historic" flood event. Here's what we know.

title.children: Flooding has created an 'inland tsunami' in remote South Australia

image.altText: Close up on soldier wearing gas mask in greenish atmosphere.

props.synopsis: Pop culture might mock doomsday preppers, but in some cases, their mindset can teach us helpful lessons.

title.children: Beyond 'bunker mentality': How preppers are planning for the next crisis

image.altText: A white spot infected prawn

props.synopsis: A ban on the sale of green prawns from the Clarence River could be extended by another two years, potentially marking the end of the 80-year industry.

title.children: Prawn disease resurfaces just as two-year bans were about to end

image.altText: Man leans against fence, looks across farmland towards a peninsula in the distance.

props.synopsis: As Labor continues to target 82 per cent renewables by 2030, the amount of wind and solar in regional communities will continue to scale up. But balancing community and environmental interests has been challenging for companies and governments.

title.children: 'It split the town': Australia grappling with wind farms and social licence

image.altText: A still-standing Buddha statue appears to survey the debris beneath and surrounding him after the earthquake in Myanmar.

props.synopsis: The deadly Myanmar earthquake last week was the biggest among a number of smaller quakes that rocked the region.

title.children: A spate of earthquakes just rattled the Asia Pacific. Should we worry?

image.altText: Lizard rescued from litter in outback Queensland

props.synopsis: Travelling along a dusty road in north-west Queensland, a strange sight caught Finn Cain's attention. A drink can was running across the road ahead.

title.children: Drink can with legs turns out to be a lizard in need of rescue

image.altText: King Charles in a black tuxedo looking to the side alongside Queen Camilla smiling in a turquoise gown

props.synopsis: King Charles and Queen Camilla have met Pope Frances privately at the Vatican's Casa Santa Marta, where the pontiff has offered his best wishes for their 20th wedding anniversary.

title.children: King Charles and Camilla make surprise visit to Pope Francis

image.altText: An Australian male basketball player passes the ball to his left at the Tokyo Olympics.

props.synopsis: The Sydney Kings sign NBL star Matthew Dellavedova to a three-year deal, nabbing him away from Melbourne United.

title.children: Dellavedova signs with the Kings in major coup for NBL heavyweights

image.altText: Mallory Swanson runs past Mary Fowler

props.synopsis: Female athletes will be in the majority at Los Angeles Olympic Games as quota spots confirmed, with the move good news for Australia's sprint swimmers and opening up the prospect of a Lee super team in mixed-team golf.

title.children: Women to be in majority at Olympics for first time in LA

image.altText: Two black bags hanging at a door entry point

props.synopsis: Experts show us simple and easy methods to help keep school backpacks and lunch boxes clean and fresh.

title.children: Machine or hand wash? How to clean backpacks and fabric lunch boxes

image.altText: Close-up of Cillian Murphy wearing a beanie.

props.synopsis: This adaptation of Claire Keegan's Booker-nominated novel, Small Things Like These, tells a heartbreaking story using an undercurrent of menace and Cillian Murphy's expressive eyes.

title.children: Cillian Murphy has used his fame to tell a very Irish tragic tale
